thread.title: Cowboys' Bryant 'incredibly unlikely' to play Week 7
thread.title_full: Cowboys' Bryant 'incredibly unlikely' to play Week 7

author: Mark Morales-Smith
title: Cowboys' Bryant 'incredibly unlikely' to play Week 7
text:
Cowboys' Bryant 'incredibly unlikely' to play Week 7 Scout.com 8 hrs ago Mark Morales-Smith BREAKING FANTASY NEWS
AdChoices Dallas Cowboys wide receiver Dez Bryant has been targeting a Week 7 return from surgery on a broken bone in his foot. Both Jerry and Stephen Jones have insisted it was a realistic return date, although, it would be well ahead of his timetable. NFL.com's Ian Rapoport reports Bryant is "incredibly unlikely" to play Week 7. He went on to add that he "may not even be practicing yet."
FANTASY ANALYSIS
Sorry Bryant owners. Of course I feel like the bearer of bad news. Don't want to be it, but it's needed, so what have you. It appears he still may be a ways away. His injury was a back-breaker for fantasy owners. However, look at it this way, if you can survive this long without him, imagine how strong your team will be once he returns. That's a glass is a quarter full outlook, nonetheless, you'll just have to make due for the time being. He should be considered week to week at this point.
Source: Ian Rapoport via Twitter
